      • testTargetIsAttendee

        public void testTargetIsAttendee​(java.util.UUID conferenceUUID,
                                 java.util.UUID executorUUID,
                                 java.util.UUID targetUserUUID)
        Validates that a target user is an attendee (i.e. a user different than the executor). Raises a PermissionException otherwise.
        Parameters:
        conferenceUUID - UUID of the convention to operate on
        executorUUID - UUID of the user running the command
        targetUserUUID - UUID of the user the command is operating on

      • testTargetsAreAttendee

        public void testTargetsAreAttendee​(java.util.UUID conferenceUUID,
                                   java.util.UUID executorUUID,
                                   java.util.Set<java.util.UUID> targetUserUUIDs)
        Validates that a set of target users can execute attendee actions for a convention. Raises a PermissionException otherwise.

        Used for operations such as an organizer creating a conversation with a convention attendee. We need to make sure that the attendee is actually affiliated with this convention, otherwise the organizer can slide into the DMs of whoever they want.

        Parameters:
        conferenceUUID - UUID of the convention to operate on
        executorUUID - UUID of the user running the command
        targetUserUUIDs - set of UUIDs of the user the command is operating on

      • testIsAttendeeSelfOrAdmin

        public void testIsAttendeeSelfOrAdmin​(java.util.UUID conferenceUUID,
                                      java.util.UUID executorUUID,
                                      java.util.UUID targetUserUUID)
        Validates that the current user is executing operations on themselves, or an admin is executing those commands on their behalf.

        For example, a user may leave a convention, or an organizer can remove them. In either case, they should both call the same "leave convention" method. Instead of writing duplicate code, we can simply check if the executor is the user (so running it as themself), or if it's an admin performing the action.

        Parameters:
        conferenceUUID - UUID of the convention to operate on
        executorUUID - UUID of the user running the command
        targetUserUUID - UUID of the user the command is operating on
